citation.article-title: Chloroherpeton thalassium gen. nov. et spec. nov., a non-filamentous, flexing and gliding green sulfur bacterium

p.s: Cells 1 μm wide and 8-30 μm long.
Flexing and gliding motility, about 1 cell length per rain.
Contain bacteriochlorophyll c as main pigment; small content of bacteriochlorophyll a.
Typical single-membrane bounded chlorosomes underlying cytoplasmic membrane.
Type strain also contains gas vesicles.
Light green, fluffy colonies formed in 0.8°C agar media.
DNA Base Composition. 45.0- 48.2 mol% G + C.
Obligate photoautotrophy, requiring CO2 as main source of cell carbon, and S2- as reductant.
Elemental sulfur deposited outside cells, and disappears only slowly from the culture, S2O32- will not replace S2-.
Growth rate and yield stimulated slightly by a number of mono- and dicarboxylic acids.
Marine littoral sediments from Cape Cod, USA.
GB-78, which has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) Rockville, Maryland, number 35110.
